sentence.Network_en: Thinkers and poets throughout the ages have offered the courtesan the oblation of their mercy.
sentence.Network_cn: 各个时期的思想家和诗人都把仁慈的怜悯心奉献给娼家女子.

sentence.Network_en: All the people of the land shall give this oblation for the prince in Israel.
sentence.Network_cn: 16此地的民都要奉上这供物给以色列中的王.

sentence.Network_en: All the people of the land shall give this oblation the prince in Israel.
sentence.Network_cn: 此地的民、都要奉上这供物给以色列中的王.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from late Latin oblatio(n-), from Latin offerre 'to offer'

means.word_mean: 1. the act of contributing to the funds of a church or charity;

auth_sentence.content: Speculation, validation, not outright oblation, right?
